event: Date of Referendum Announced and New Deal Negotiated
Theresa May Announces Intention to Leave by March
European Union (Notification of Withdrawal) Bill given royal assent
EU Withdrawal Bill passes second reading.
Government outlines plan for withdrawal agreement and implementation bill
European Union (Withdrawal) Bill recieves royal assent.
Cabinet meet at Chequers to agree on position.
David Davis resigns as Brexit Secretary.
Withdrawal Agreement Published and Dominic Raab resigns next day.
MPs begin first of five days of Brexit debates, leading up to “Meaningful Vote”.
Theresa May wins Vote of Confidence in Conservative Party
Prime Minister wins vote of confidence.
MPs vote to rule out no deal.
Prime Minister loses 3rd Meaningful Vote on original departure date.
Prime Minister unveils new Brexit Deal
Benn Act is passed. General Election is refused.
Supreme Court rules that proroguement was unlawful.
PM presents new Brexit Deal, but is defeated. Letwin amendment passed.
EU (Withdrawal Agreement) Bill passes second reading.
